articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Hideous Provocation to Be Shattered-- KPA Supreme Command
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Hideous Provocation to Be Shattered-- KPA Supreme Command
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army released the following statement on Wednesday:
					 These days the Lee Myung Bak group's anti-DPRK confrontation racket is going beyond such danger line that it cannot be left to take its own course.
					
					 Typical of this was that the Third Infantry Division of the puppet Fifth Army Corps in the central sector of the front and other units in the forefront areas again seriously hurt the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and deliberately spoke ill of its system and army.
					
					 They displayed slogans and placards at lots of barracks and posts of the puppet army, military facilities and guideboards and walls on nearby roads. This was hysteria which can be kicked off only by the group of traitors and a hideous provocation which can be perpetrated only by hooligans who go wild like "puppies knowing no fear of a tiger".
					
					 The developments go to clearly prove that the bellicose and blatant challenges daring hurt the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and slander its inviolable system are nothing new but have been perpetrated in a systematic and premeditated manner on the script of traitor Lee Myung Bak and the military hooligans since long ago.
					
					 No wonder, south Korean inhabitants are labeling such provocations as "something shocking", "reckless acts of sending a chill to the hearts of even strangers", "a premeditated plot to foster confrontation with fellow countrymen" and "behaviors of psychopaths reminiscent of the war atmosphere in the 60s and the 70s".
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that such ceaseless hideous provocations have not been committed by a few individual hooligans of the puppet military but perpetrated by the group as part of its "state policy" and pursuant to "the guidelines" of the group of puppet military warmongers for stoking bitterness towards the DPRK. 
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by the fact that a whole string of reckless remarks calling for confrontation with fellow countrymen were let loose by Lee Myung Bak at Chongwadae and high-ranking military officers including puppet Defense Minister Kim Kwan Jin were locked in confabs over the issue of hurting the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK in their office rooms. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK cannot but regard all these hideous crimes against the nation and the DPRK as the highest treason as they stunned the public at home and abroad and cannot but deal with this open military provocation as an urgent case.
					
					 The Supreme Command of the KPA will regard the reckless behaviors of the group of traitors adding to its hideous crimes against the nation as a new declaration of war against the DPRK from now on and will take corresponding military retaliatory measures in reflection of the towering resentment of all servicepersons and people and their pledge to take revenge upon the enemy. 
					
					The Lee group of traitors is the sworn enemy with whom the Koreans cannot live under the same sky and the bellicose forces of the puppet military are the group of traitors to be wiped out by force of arms.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK will take merciless military retaliatory measures with every means and method involved till the group puts an end to all acts of hurting the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and defiling its system and army and makes an apology to the nation for them.
					
					 All the compatriotic military steps so far taken by the army of the DPRK for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations would prove to be stringent sanctions of DPRK style against the puppet authorities and military warmongers.
					
					 Now that the worst confrontation maniacs in the world dared to perpetrate such extreme provocation against the DPRK as not ruling out even a war against it, there will be only physical stand-off between the north and the south. 
					
					 They will come to clearly realize what stern punishment by force of arms will be meted out by the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 No force on earth can match the servicepersons and people of the DPRK, their hearts burning with the determination to take a thousand-fold revenge upon the enemy. There is a limit to their patience. 
					
					 Only sledge-hammer blows of the nation await those who direct accusing fingers at the sky, not content with denying the socialist system in the dignified DPRK.
					
					 Its servicepersons and people will foil the reckless heinous provocations of the group with merciless retaliatory blows and certainly accomplish the historic cause of national reunification, the desire of all Koreans, at an early date.

articles.title: CPRK Opens to Public Notice to Chongwadae of S. Korea
articles.content:
CPRK Opens to Public Notice to Chongwadae of S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) tried to send an urgent notice to the south Korean authorities through Panmunjom today in connection with the fact that "Paekgol unit" of the south Korean puppet forces and other forefront units are committing heinous provocations defiling the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and its system and army.
					 But the puppet authorities did not accept the notice of the DPRK side under the unreasonable pretext as they felt guilty for what they have done.
					
					 Under this situation the CPRK decided to open to public the notice addressed to Chongwadae.
					
					 The notice said:
					
					 According to south Korean media, "Paekgol unit" in Cholwon, south Korean Kangwon Province and other forefront units set up slogans heaping malignant slanders and calumnies on the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and its system and army in their barracks and posts and on military facilities and walls and are inciting extreme hostility toward it.
					
					 This is one more unpardonable hideous provocation and a declaration of a war against the DPRK.
					
					 When the south side's military set up and fired at the targets hurting the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK, it warned the south side of its gravity. It also strongly demanded the south side immediately make apology, punish the prime movers and take measures to prevent the recurrence of similar incident.
					
					 The south side, in fact, apologized to the DPRK, describing it as an "inappropriate happening" and saying it "took relevant measures in the units."
					
					 The recent hideous provocations prove these were just lies and that Chongwadae and senior military officers were the architects of the provocations.
					
					 The south side should immediately make apology for the recent provocations, punish the prime movers, remove all the foul slogans and stop reckless provocations at once.
					
					 If the south side continues to connive at the provocations defiling the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and its system and army, the DPRK will resolutely counter them with an all-out military retaliation and merciless measures for punishment as it had already warned in statements.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket Flailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket Flailed
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Reconciliation Council in a statement on June 28 denounced the south Korean puppet conservative group for brutally suppressing the actions of the south Korean people for independence, democracy, reunification and vital rights on the strength of the "National Security Law", an anti-reunification fascist law.
					 The number of the organizations labeled by the Lee Myung Bak group as "illegal organizations" on charges of the violation of the NSL after it took office reached thousands and that of the arrested reunification activists more than quadrupled as compared with that during its preceding regime, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The NSL, which was became less toothless after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, has now become more draconic due to the conservative group, turning south Korea into rowdyism of fascism and a barren land of democracy and human rights.
					
					 Not content with this, the Lee group appointed a wicked element who insisted on maintaining the NSL as chairman of the human rights commission. The group is becoming all the more pronounced in its moves to enact an extremely undesirable "North Korean Human Rights Law" while getting more frantic with its moves to intensify human rights abuses.
					
					 The above-said law is a more draconic one against the DPRK and reunification than the ill-famed NSL.
					
					 Voices calling for the total abolition of the NSL are growing stronger than ever before in south Korea and it has become a target of international criticism.
					
					 The participants in the 17th meeting of the UN Human Rights Council held in Geneva recently branded the NSL as an anti-human rights law and strongly demanded its abolition.
					
					  The puppet group of traitors should abolish the NSL at an early date as required by public opinion at home and abroad and stop at once its moves to enact the above-said law.
					
					  Otherwise, it will be more sternly rebuffed and condemned by the south Koreans and all other fellow countrymen and world public and meet a disgraceful end.

articles.title: Salute to 17th AU Summit
articles.content:
Salute to 17th AU Summit
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to the 17th Summit of the African Union (AU) to be held in Malabo.
					 Kim in the message said that ideas and efforts of the AU for ensuring peace and stability of the continent and achieving its political and economic integration command widespread support and sympathy of the developing countries in their drive to powerfully spur social progress and independent development of the region and establish fair and equal international relations.
					
					 He manifested the firm solidarity of the Korean people with the just cause of the African people for building independent, prosperous and powerful Africa and reiterated the invariable stand of the DPRK government to boost the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation with the AU and its member states.
					
					 He sincerely hoped that the summit, which will mark an important occasion in achieving the peace, security and sustainable development of Africa, would yield good fruits in keeping with the common desire and interests of its member states.

articles.title: Greeting to Sudanese President
articles.content:
Greeting to Sudanese President 
Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir, president of Sudan, on the 22nd Revolution Day in Sudan.
					Kim heartily wished the President and people of Sudan greater success in their work to achieve the security, stability, economic development and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between two countries would grow stronger in the days ahead.

articles.title: Greeting to President of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Greeting to President of Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of Democratic Congo, on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of independence of his country.
					 Kim in the message expressed the belief that the traditional and good friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Democratic Congo would grow stronger in conformity with the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Academy Ensemble
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Academy Ensemble
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Chief of the Ensemble Viktor Yeliseev on Wednesday.

articles.title: Russian Academy Ensemble Gives Its Premiere
articles.content:
Russian Academy Ensemble Gives Its Premiere
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The visiting Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior gave its premiere at the Ponghwa Art Theatre Wednesday.
					 The ensemble made up of talented and well-known actors and actresses put on the stage songs, orchestras and dances which deal with strong national flavor and ardent love for the country.
					
					 In chorus and orchestra "Warring People", dance "Soldiers' Dance" and other numbers the artistes successfully represented their thematic contents with perfect ensemble, refined rendition and rich voice.
					
					 They successfully presented male solo and chorus "Eternal Friends of Korea and Russia" and Korean song "General of Korea" to be acclaimed by the audience.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Pyong Hun, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea, Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, and officials, creators and artistes in the field of literature and art.
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: Chinese Film Week Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Film Week Opens in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A Chinese film week was open in the DPRK to mark the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China.
					 An opening ceremony took place at the Taedongmun Cinema House Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik, chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, and others, Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Chinese embassy officials here and Chinese residents and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 An Tong Chun said the fraternal Chinese people have registered great achievements in the drive to put into practice a scientific outlook on development and build a harmonious society this year, the first year of the 12th Five-Year Plan under the leadership of the CPC.
					
					 The Korean people will boost the exchange and cooperation between the two countries in all fields of culture and art including movie art in the days ahead, he stressed.
					
					 Liu Hongcai said the film show will greatly contribute to jointly celebrating the 90th anniversary of the CPC in the two countries and record a brilliant chapter in the history of Sino-DPRK exchange of culture and art.
					
					 And it will offer an opportunity to know about the history of the Chinese revolution, he said, stressing the need to boost the friendly relations between the two parties and the two countries in the future.
					
					 The participants watched a Chinese feature film.

articles.title: Syrian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Syrian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Charge d'Affaires ad interim Souheil Haidar and Syrian embassy officials here Wednesday did a friendly labor at the DPRK-Syria Friendship Wonhwa Cooperative Farm in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province.
					They went round the monuments to the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the Wonhwa Revolutionary Museum and buildings and fields associated with the revolutionary feats of the President.
					
					 They helped the farmers in weeding fields and handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Remains of More Martyrs Buried in Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery
articles.content:
Remains of More Martyrs Buried in Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Remains of more martyrs who performed feats in achieving the prosperity of the country and accomplishing the socialist cause were buried in the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery on the suburbs with due ceremonies in the DPRK on June 28 and 29. 
					 They included former General Officer of the Korean People's Army Kim Kun Ok who contributed to sinking a heavy cruiser of the U.S. imperialists with four torpedo boats in the Jumunjin naval battle in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War and former KPA General Officer Ri Su Hyon who contributed to the strengthening and development of revolutionary armed forces for several decades after the liberation of the country. 
					
					 Also among them were O Tae Hyong, sculptor of the Mansudae Art Studio, Kwon Jong Ung, writer of the April 15 Literary Production Company, Kim Su Jo, president of the Phibada Opera Troupe, and Yun Ki Jong, former minister of Finance. 
					
					 Present at the ceremonies were Kim Jong Im, director of the Party History Institute of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, servicepersons and members of bereaved families.
					
					 After speeches were made, the remains were buried in the cemetery. 
					
					 Participants laid wreaths and bouquets before the graves of the martyrs and paid silent tribute to them.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Lambasted for Anti-DPRK Provocation
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Lambasted for Anti-DPRK Provocation
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang people have become incensed against the south Korean regime after the DPRK government spokesman released a statement on Tuesday denouncing it for slandering the social system and dignity of the DPRK.
					 Sin Yong Myong, a 46-year-old worker of the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, told KCNA the south Korean puppet regime insulted the social system and dignity of the DPRK again after hurting the dignity of its leadership. 
					
					 The reckless act shows that the regime is a sworn enemy of the Korean nation, he said. If the confrontation maniacs dare to attack the DPRK, ignoring its repeated warnings, we workers will smash the invaders at a blow. 
					
					 Sin Myong Ok, a 39-year-old worker of Pyongyang Department Store No.1, said traitor Lee Myung Bak will never escape a stern punishment of history for the anti-national, anti-reunification and anti-DPRK crimes he has committed since he came to power.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime should make an apology for the provocation and stop the reckless confrontation racket at once, he added.

articles.title: Colorful Painting in Koguryo Tomb Murals
articles.content:
Colorful Painting in Koguryo Tomb Murals 
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Colorful painting is one of the main features of ancient buildings in Korea. They have colorful pictures and patterns on pillars, rafters, walls and ceilings.
					 Koguryo tomb murals also have colorful painting.
					
					 Beams, trusses and props drawn on murals in a tomb in Tokhung-ri, Kangso District, Nampho City and tombs No. 2 and 3 in Anak County, South Hwanghae Province are all decorated with cloud, bine, flame and other patterns.
					
					 The painting is characterized by different but harmonious colors.
					
					 The Taedong Gate in Central District is typical of the colorfully patterned ancient buildings in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Mt. Myohyang Blessed with Biodiversity
articles.content:
Mt. Myohyang Blessed with Biodiversity
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Mt. Myohyang, one of the famous mountains in Korea, boasts of biodiversity.
					 The mountain has different habitats in valleys.
					
					 What is important in the mountain's biodiversity is the water ecosystem made up of many waterfalls and streams.
					
					 The mountain has many varieties of living things.
					
					 The species of the plants in the mountain are believed to be over 1,000.
					
					 Not only plants of the temperate zone like Mongolia oak and ash tree but also those of the subarctic zone like spruce are growing in the mountain.
					
					 The animals include musk deer, otter and black woodpecker and the species of butterflies total more than 150.
					
					 A survey made a few years ago shows that there are over 190 kinds of birds and the number is expected to reach 220-230 in the future.
					
					 Various spectacular sights of the mountain constitute another feature of the mountain's biodiversity. 
					
					 The mountain was registered as an international biosphere reserve by UNESCO in May Juche 98 (2009). 
					
					 Mt. Myohyang has become a world-famous tourist resort.

articles.title: "Song of National Defence"
articles.content:
"Song of National Defence"
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- "Song of National Defence" represents the Korean people's patriotism and spirit of defending the country. 
					 The song was written by Jo Ryong Chul and composed by Ri Myon Sang in 1950 when the United States unleashed a war against the DPRK. 
					
					 The Korean army and people devoted themselves to defending the country and won the war fought from June 25, 1950 to July 27, 1953, under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, a brilliant strategist.
					
					 The song mirrors the soldiers' pride in defending the homeland and their strong will to safeguard every inch of the country from the enemy attack.
					
					 It is replete with their unshakable determination to ensure the country's development and prosperity with arms of justice. 
					
					 The song, with dynamic and appealing melodies, is sill popular in the country.

articles.title: Juche Character, National Identity Preserved in Korea
articles.content:
Juche Character, National Identity Preserved in Korea
Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il published a celebrated work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" in June Juche 86 (1997).
					 The work gives ways for promoting the country's development by preserving the Juche character and national identity in the revolution and construction.
					
					 Led by the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), the Korean people have dealt with all problems independently on the principle of national self-determination.
					
					 Even under difficult circumstances, the DPRK has paid much effort to beefing up defense capabilities and strengthening the army.
					
					 Following the revolutionary soldier spirit, all the people have turned out in the effort for the building of a thriving nation and provided foundations for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 A number of cultural heritages have been discovered or restored and traditional customs further developed in the country.
					
					 Many literary and art works, national in form and socialist in content, have also been created.

articles.title: Path of Korean Revolution
articles.content:
Path of Korean Revolution
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung convened a meeting of cadres of the Young Communist League and the Anti-imperialist Youth League in Kalun on June 30, Juche 19 (1930).
					 The President told the meeting that the popular masses are responsible for the revolution and that the Korean revolution should be undertaken by the Korean people to suit the actual conditions of the country.
					
					 He also defined the character, main tasks, motive power and target of the Korean revolution and put forward a Juche-based line and policy of the revolution.
					
					 In that period the Japanese imperialists were intensifying suppression and plunder in Korea, their colony, as part of their preparations for an aggression on the Asian continent.
					
					 Such being the situation, the Korean people began resisting the Japanese imperialists by violence but failed as they had neither outstanding leader nor correct line and policy.
					
					 From the early period of his revolutionary activities, Kim Il Sung had rejected flunkeyism and dogmatism and established a correct guiding idea of the Korean revolution suitable for the specific conditions of the country.
					
					 The idea is contained in "The Path of the Korean Revolution", a report he delivered at the Kalun meeting.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Greeting Elections of Deputies to Local Power Organs
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Greeting Elections of Deputies to Local Power Organs 
						
Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean citizens should turn out as one in the work to greet the elections of deputies to the local power organs with high political enthusiasm and shining labor achievements and make a positive contribution to cementing the people's power. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in an editorial.
					
					The DPRK power is a powerful political weapon of the revolution and construction and a true servant for the people, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 The history of the development of the DPRK power is shining as a glorious path along which it has creditably performed its mission as a representative of independent rights of the popular masses, an organizer of creative ability and activities and the master responsible for the livelihood of the people, while setting an example in the era of building the socialist power under the wise leadership of the great leader and the great party.
					
					  The forthcoming elections are an important political work to cement the people's power as required by the developing reality.
					
					 The militant might of the Workers' Party of Korea has been remarkably augmented with the historic Conference of the Party as a momentum and a general onward movement for building a thriving nation is now brisk under the leadership of the party.
					
					 When the local power organs are made up of representatives of the people and their function and role are increased considerably through the elections, a revolutionary turn will be effected in implementing the Party's line and policies and the victory of building a thriving nation will come earlier than expected.
					
					 Everybody should participate in the elections with high political enthusiasm and thus demonstrate once again the intense loyalty of the Korean people to greet the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as the greatest revolutionary holiday of the nation.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Fostering of Militarism Termed Dangerous
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Fostering of Militarism Termed Dangerous 
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Osaka Prefecture of Japan worked out "regulations" and published them recently obliging teachers of public schools to stand up during the playing of "Kimigayo."
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 This is a clear indication that the Japanese reactionaries are making desperate efforts to stoke militarism.
					
					 Laying bare the ulterior aims sought by the Japanese reactionaries in defining "Kimigayo," the song bearing the towering grudge of Asian people, as Japan's national anthem and, furthermore, publishing even "regulations" obliging Japanese to pay "respect" and "tribute" to it, the commentary goes on:
					
					 They are, in a nutshell, aimed at making the playing of "Kimigayo" part of official functions in a bid to lay an ideological groundwork of militarism and make the blood-stained past history repeat itself. 
					
					 By applying the above-said "regulations" to the teachers the Japanese reactionaries seek to implant the militarist view on history and revanchist sentiment into the minds of naive students and train them as right-wing elements and national chauvinists and thus use them as a shock brigade for overseas aggression. 
					
					 The Japanese militarist forces may embark upon the road of reinvasion anytime as they are getting ready to take revenge for their past defeat, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Security Forces' Suppression of Young Activists under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Security Forces' Suppression of Young Activists under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet security forces on June 23 kicked up a racket of suppressing former members of the Kangrung Youth Society by invoking the "National Security Law".
					 That day the security investigation group of the Kangwon District Police Agency and the Kangwon Branch of the Intelligence Service searched all of a sudden houses of three persons including Kwon Pyong Song, former chairman of the society, and confiscated computers, documents, books, etc. Then they ordered them to appear at the police agency.
					
					 The fascists took such action, asserting they were suspected of the violation of the NSL when acting at the Council of Youth Organizations.
					
					 The victims and members of civic and public organizations of south Korean Kangwon Provincial areas branded such search operation as a politically-motivated premeditated crackdown intended to tide over the crisis.

articles.title: Field Mobile Exercise to Be Staged by S. Korean Puppet Forces
articles.content:
Field Mobile Exercise to Be Staged by S. Korean Puppet Forces
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The First Division of the south Korean puppet army announced a plan for kicking off a field mobile exercise in the area of Phaju City, Kyonggi Province on June 27, the south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					 The warmongers blared that the exercise which will last till July 1 with tanks and other war hardware and huge armed forces involved is aimed to cope with various situations including an all-out war.
					
					 This saber-rattling to be staged pursuant to their scenario for a war against the DPRK is a dangerous confrontation racket aimed at dampening the desire of the fellow countrymen for peace and reunification and leading the situation to the brink of war.

articles.title: Sophism Calling for Construction of Military Base Rebuffed
articles.content:
Sophism Calling for Construction of Military Base Rebuffed
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The All-Islanders Measure Committee for Checking Jeju Military Base and other organizations of south Korea issued a joint commentary on June 24 denouncing the governor of Jeju Island for his remarks asserting the construction of a naval base.
					 That day the governor let loose a string of balderdash at a press conference that the construction of the Jeju naval base cannot be retracted and what is important is how to develop the area around the base, the commentary noted, and continued:
					
					 It is not the first time that the governor told nonsense calling for its construction.
					
					 If he persistently throws wet blanket on the people's actions against the construction of the military base, the people cannot but call his qualification into question, it warned.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves for War under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves for War under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on June 25 bitterly denounced the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for its moves for a war.
					 Recalling that the June 25 war took the lives of many people and turned the whole territory of the country into a sea of fire, the commentary said it taught a bitter lesson that peace is the only way out.
					
					 The present chief executive, oblivious of the above-said lesson, has pushed the inter-Korean relations to the brink of war in total refusal to implement the June 15 joint declaration, the declaration for independence, peace and reunification, though it has commanded absolute support from the fellow countrymen, the commentary noted, and went on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime and the gentries of the "Grand National Party" are openly crying out for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, a dangerous act of calling for a new war.
					
					 The people are demanding the replacement of the Lee regime at an early date in order to prevent the second June 25 war, it said, calling for waging a dynamic struggle to repair the inter-Korean relations and achieve peace on the Korean Peninsula in the future.

articles.title: Violence against S. Korean Workers Slammed
articles.content:
Violence against S. Korean Workers Slammed
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, the chairman of the Metal Trade Union, lawyers and others held a press conference at the "National Assembly" on June 24 denouncing the brutal violence committed against workers of the Yusong Enterprise.
					 Speakers at the press conference accused the Yusong Enterprise side of illegally closing a shop and hurling gangsters into assaulting the workers who had been on a protest action.
					
					 When gangsters beat the workers with clubs, the police did not take any step against this violence but unhesitatingly sprayed tear gas on them, they charged.
					
					 The police's violence left more than 10 workers wounded, they noted, labeling the Yusong Enterprise side and police's violence totally illegal acts.
					
					 That day representatives of labor movement organizations and social activists held a press conference at a press center to publish a declaration on the situation. Noting that nothing could be expected from the authorities any longer as they are infringing upon the right of the people to live through resolution and layoff, expansion of part-time jobs and violence, they declared they would take the lead in the struggle for winning the vital rights.

articles.title: Candlelight Actions Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Candlelight Actions Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean students held a candlelight rally at Chonggye Square in Seoul on June 26 together with lawmakers of opposition parties and citizens.
					 At the rally speakers said that students have launched information service on registration fee issue at major points and subways in the city from June 25.
					
					 Their actions are evoking lively response by citizens, they noted.
					
					 They said they will fight it out against the authorities' repression to get the demand of the students met without fail.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at Russian School
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at Russian School
Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of laying a floral basket before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il was held at 11th Middle School in Khabarovsk City, Russia on June 19, the 47th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Participants laid the floral basket before the portraits at a classroom of Russia-Korea Children's Friendship Association Named after Kim Jong Il and made bows.
					
					 Principal of the school Ludmila Levkova said the DPRK has wrought world-startling miracles and innovations in political, economic, cultural, military and all other fields for the past 47 years since Kim Jong Il started his work at the Central Committee of the WPK.
					
					 Ludmila hoped the Korean people would make steady great progress in the efforts to build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Il and live happily in a reunified country.

articles.title: Cuba Will Extend Invariable Support to Korea's Reunification: Cuban Official
articles.content:
Cuba Will Extend Invariable Support to Korea's Reunification: Cuban Official
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The Cuban people will extend invariable support and encouragement to the Korean people in their cause for the country's reunification, said Juan Jose Leon Vega, first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification.
					 At an opening ceremony for the month of international solidarity with the Korean people held in Cuba on June 22 he referred to the solidity of the friendship between the two countries.
					
					 He said the U.S. imperialists egged the south Korean puppet forces on to launch a war of aggression against the DPRK on June 25, 1950. But its army and people turned out to defend their land at the cost of their lives, he added.
					
					The Cuban people have positively conducted solidarity movement supporting the cause of the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea for which President Kim Il Sung worked heart and soul till the last moments of his life and to which General Secretary Kim Jong Il has devoted his all, he said.
					
					 The peoples of Cuba and the DPRK are comrades-in-arms at the same trench of the anti-imperialist front, he said, emphasizing the U.S. imperialists can never bring the two peoples to their knees.
					
					 Present at the ceremony on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Cuba and his embassy staff.

articles.title: Foreign Media Mark Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK C.C.
articles.content:
Foreign Media Mark Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK C.C.
Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried commemorative reports to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 A Russian paper on June 15 carried a photo of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together. It also carried a photo of Kimjongilia and a commemorative article.
					
					 The article said celebrations were held in Russia on the significant anniversary to praise the party leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il. It introduced Kimjongilia, immortal flower, in detail.
					
					 The Syrian newspaper Al Baath on June 20 said as the leader for the people Kim Jong Il performed big exploits for the construction, development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 A Senegalese newspaper on June 18 said the DPRK is demonstrating its might as a country in which the party, the army and the people are united around the leader in single mind. The international community is convinced that the DPRK would emerge an economic power in the near future as it has laid a solid foundation for building a thriving nation, it added.
					
					 The June issue of the Indian magazine Social Look spoke highly of the greatness of Kim Jong Il who performed feats to shine long in the history of building the revolutionary party through his extraordinary ideological and theoretical activities and leadership.
					
					 An Ecuadorian TV showed the DPRK film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" on June 11 and 12.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK C.C. Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK Central Committee Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Congo, Uganda, Iran and Colombia on June 18 and 19 to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and to hail his successful visit to China.
					 Displayed were photos on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has brought about big changes in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields with his distinguished ideological and theoretical activities and outstanding leadership for nearly half a century since he started his work at the Central Committee of the WPK, said the chairman of the Congolese National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Bright is the future of the DPRK in which the party, the army and the people are united close around Kim Jong Il in single mind, he added.
					
					 The secretary general of the African Regional Committee of Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People said Kim Jong Il's recent visit to China greatly contributed to the development of the DPRK-China friendly relations. It created external environment favorable for building a thriving socialist nation in the DPRK, he added.
					
					 The DPRK would eternally prosper as it is led by Kim Jong Il, he emphasized.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Congo.

articles.title: China Clarifies Its Stand to Invite Sudanese President
articles.content:
China Clarifies Its Stand to Invite Sudanese President
 Beijing, June 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs recently clarified its stand to invite Sudanese President Omar Al-Bashir to his country despite accusations by human rights organizations.
					 The Chinese government has the right to invite Bashir who has been supported by China for years, he said.
					
					 The International Criminal Court issued a warrant of arrest for Bashir for his genocide and war crimes but China is not a signatory to the treaty on setting up the International Criminal Court, he noted.

articles.title: China Gives Importance to Work in Field of Party Organization
articles.content:
China Gives Importance to Work in Field of Party Organization
 Beijing, June 28 (KCNA) -- Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau, member of the Secretariat and head of the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, underlined the need to push forward the work in the field of party organization at a recent seminar on party building marking the 90th anniversary of the party founding.
					 He called for displaying the good tradition in the party building and the work in the field of party organization and opening a new phase and thus providing a powerful organizational guarantee for boosting the party's governing ability, promoting progressive nature and attaining the goal to build a comprehensively well-off society.

articles.title: China Takes Steps for Preventing Flood Damage
articles.content:
China Takes Steps for Preventing Flood Damage
 Beijing, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the central group for guiding activities to build advanced basic party organizations and help its members become good members in a recent notice called upon the party organizations and leading party members to take the lead in the drive to prevent flood and recover from its disasters.
					 The notice underscored the need for the party organizations at various levels to regard it as the primary duty to ensure the safety of the popular masses with a high degree of political responsibility and for the leading party members to play the role of vanguard.

articles.title: China Intensifies Combat against Drug Trafficking
articles.content:
China Intensifies Combat against Drug Trafficking
						
 Beijing, June 28 (KCNA) -- The customs field of China shattered 287 cases of drug trafficking from January to May this year.  478.5 kg of drugs of various kinds were seized.
					 This was made public by the General Administration of Customs of China recently.

articles.title: Combat against Cross-Border Tele-communication Swindles Called for
articles.content:
Combat against Cross-Border Tele-communication Swindles Called for
 Beijing, June 28 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, state councilor and minister of Public Security of China, stressed the need to thoroughly combat multi-national and cross-border tele-communication               swindles at recent round-table talks with public security policemen in Beijing.
					 He called on both sides sharing borders to boost cooperation with international police forces with priority given to protecting the interests of the popular masses and thus make a great contribution to protecting the public security of society and security of their lives and properties.

articles.title: Number of CPC Members on Steady Increase
articles.content:
Number of CPC Members on Steady Increase
 Beijing, June 28 (KCNA) -- The number of the members of the Communist Party of China reached 80,269,000 as of the end of 2010.
					 Women party members accounted for 18,030,000 or 22.5 percent of the total party members, university graduates 29,775 000 or 37.1 percent of its membership, a report said.

articles.title: Revolutionary Classic Serial Picture Books Published in China
articles.content:
Revolutionary Classic Serial Picture Books Published in China
 Beijing, June 28 (KCNA) -- China has brought out 100 kinds of revolutionary classic serial picture books marking the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China.
					 Contained in the books are works created by the People's Art Publishing House, Shanghai People's Art Publishing House, Tianjin People's Art Publishing House and the Serial Picture Book Publishing House after the founding of new China, a report said.

articles.title: Russian Presidential Prize Awarded to Young Cultural Activists
articles.content:
Russian Presidential Prize Awarded to Young Cultural Activists
						
 Moscow, June 28 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev signed a degree "On awarding the prize of the president of the Russian Federation to young Russian cultural activists for 2010".
					 According to it, the prize of the president and honorary title of winner of the presidential prize were conferred upon the young cultural activists.
					
					 This was notified by the Public Information Bureau of the Russian government on June 25.

articles.title: Iran's Leader Criticizes US Forces' Presence in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Iran's Leader Criticizes US Forces' Presence in Afghanistan
						
 Tehran, June 28 (KCNA) -- Leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran Seyed Ali Khamenei said the U.S. forces in Afghanistan stand in the way of recovering the security in the country. He said this at the talks with the Afghan president on a visit to his country on June 25.
					 The U.S. forces' presence is a cause of misfortune and disasters of the Afghan people and the region, he noted. 
					
					 The Afghan people can settle their issue by their own efforts, he emphasized.

articles.title: Many Countries Make Cooperation
articles.content:
Many Countries Make Cooperation
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- China and Bulgaria signed a memorandum on cooperation in information technologies and communications Friday.
					 Indonesia and Singapore on Friday agreed to increase bilateral cooperation in a discussion between both countries' foreign ministers.
					
					 Laos and Vietnam agreed to boost bilateral cooperation in the fields of economy, culture, education and science and technology on June 22.

articles.title: Tropical Storms Hit Vietnam
articles.content:
Tropical Storms Hit Vietnam
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Tropical storms hit Quang Ninh Province and Haiphong City of Vietnam on June 24, causing damage.
					 The storms left 8 people dead and 81 others wounded.
					
					 Heavy rain persists in the northern provinces, a report said. The government is taking measures to prevent damage.

articles.title: Crimes Rampant in Japan, Italy
articles.content:
Crimes Rampant in Japan, Italy
						
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Two women were found dead at a condominium in the city of Osaka, Japan Friday evening in an apparent murder case.
					Italian police on Tuesday arrested 19 Calabrian mafia suspects, including a city councilor in the northern Piedmont region.

articles.title: Traffic Accidents in US
articles.content:
Traffic Accidents in US
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- An Amtrak train collided with a tractor-trailer rig on a rural Nevada highway on Friday, killing at least two people and injuring about 60.
					 A car slammed into a group of cyclists, injuring 11 people near the border of Culver City and Los Angeles Thursday morning.

articles.title: CS del EPC condena provocaciones de banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
CS del EPC condena provocaciones de banda de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 29 de junio (ATCC) -- El portavoz de la Comandancia Suprema del Ejército Popular de Corea hizo pública el día 29 la siguiente declaración:
					En estos días, los alborotos conflictivos anti-República Popular Democrática de Corea de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak sobrepasan el límite de amenaza intolerable.
					
					   Lo prueba el hecho de que la tercera división de infantería del quinto cuerpo títere en el centro del frente y otras unidades ubicadas ahí calumniaron e insultaron otra vez gravemente la máxima dignidad de la RPDC y desacreditaron premeditadamente nuestro ejército y sistema.
					
					Ellos colgaron  satánicas consignas y pancartas en  cuarteles, puestos e instalaciones militares del ejército títere y hasta en avenidas y murallas. 
					
					  Esto deviene una locura histérica antinacional que puede cometer sólo la banda de traidores y una provocación de tamaño especial de los bandidos groseros. 
					
					La situación creada muestra que las provocaciones belicosas y brutales que denigran atrevidamente la máxima dignidad y el sagrado sistema de la RPDC no se han preparado en recientes momentos, sino se han promovido de modo premeditado y sistemático desde hace mucho tiempo según el guión del traidor Lee Myung Bak y otros bribones de la capa militar del Sur de Corea. 
					
					  Es por eso que hasta los habitantes surcoreanos las denuncian como "actos indignantes e imprudentes que horrorizan el corazón de todos", "complots ingénitos para fomentar la confrontación fratricida" y "acciones de los locos que resucitaron el ambiente de guerra de las décadas de los 60 y 70".
					
					  Lo grave del caso está en que tales provocaciones no se desarrollan como actos privados de algunos pícaros de la capa militar títere, sino como una "política estatal" de la banda de los traidores y "guía" de los belicistas títeres para inculcar la hostilidad anti-RPDC. 
					
					Lo muestran bien las maldiciones de confrontación fratricida que suele soltar el traidor Lee Myung Bak en Chongwadae, y los complots que se trazan abiertamente en las oficinas de los funcionarios militares de alto rango como el ministro títere de Defensa Kim Kwan Jin.
					
					El ejército y pueblo de Corea se ven obligados a cuestionar todos estos actos antinacionales y anti-RPDC de la banda traidora, que provocan la indignación en el interior y exterior del país, como crimen nunca tolerable y abierta provocación militar contra la RPDC. 
					
					Reflejando la indignación incontenible y el sentimiento de venganza de todos los militares y civiles, la Comandancia Suprema del Ejército Popular de Corea considerará desde ahora como nueva declaración de guerra el proceder imprudente de la banda traidora que aumenta sus archí-crímenes contra la nación y tomará las medidas militares de represalia correspondientes.
					
					La banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak es el enemigo capital que no podemos vivir juntos en el mismo territorio. Y los belicistas de la capa militar son precisamente la horda de traidores que debemos aniquilar sólo con las armas.
					
					Las fuertes medidas militares de represalia, que tomarán nuestro ejército y pueblo, se ejercerán despiadadamente por cualesquier medios y métodos hasta cuando la banda traidora elimine todos sus actos que denigran la máxima dignidad, el sistema y el ejército de nuestra parte y pida disculpas ante la nación. 
					
					Las medidas militares de carácter fraternal, que ha tomado hasta la fecha nuestro ejército en el marco de las relaciones Norte-Sur, se convertirán en las fuertes sanciones a nuestro estilo sobre las autoridades títeres y los belicistas de la capa militar. 
					
					Puesto que los maníacos de confrontación sin pares en la historia se atreven a cometer las provocaciones extremadas, inclusive la guerra, sólo queda en las relaciones Norte-Sur el saldo físico con armas.
					
					Pues, probarán desde ahora el golpe severo de las armas de nuestro ejército y pueblo. 
					
					Nadie en el mundo podrá frenar la decisión de nuestro ejército y pueblo de tomar la venganza mil veces más fuerte.
					
					Nuestra paciencia tiene su límite.
					
					A los bribones que calumnian el prestigioso régimen socialista de la RPDC y se atreven a criticar hasta su máxima dignidad, les tocará nada más que la severa sentencia de la nación. 
					
					Todos los militares y civiles de la RPDC frustrarán con las armas de represalia implacable las imprudentes provocaciones nunca vistas de la banda traidora y lograrán sin falta con antelación la histórica causa de reunificación de la patria, anhelo de toda la nación coreana.

articles.title: CRN denuncia campaña anti-RPDC de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
CRN denuncia campaña anti-RPDC de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
						
Pyongyang, 29 de junio (ATCC) -- El Consejo de Reconciliación Nacional (CRN) hizo pública el día 28 una declaración condenando a la banda de los conservadores surcoreanos que reprime de manera salvaje, en virtud de la infame "ley de seguridad", la lucha de los habitantes surcoreanos por la independencia, la democracia, la reunificación y el derecho a la vida. 
					Después de la toma del poder por la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak, fueron definidas como "ilícitas" miles de entidades y se aumentó más de 4 veces el número de las personalidades pro-reunificación encarceladas en comparación con el "poder" anterior.
					
					Por la banda conservadora se pone en vigencia esa infame ley fascista anti-reunificación, que estaba en desanimación después del 15 de junio de 2000, y el Sur de Corea se ha convertido en una sociedad fascista y en el infierno de la democracia y de derechos humanos. 
					
					No satisfecho con esto, Lee Myung Bak denominó como presidente de la llamada comisión de DDHH a un tipejo de peor calaña que persistía el mantenimiento de la "ley de seguridad", hace esfuerzos frenéticos por reprimir los derechos humanos y pretende fabricar la "ley de DDHH del Norte". 
					
					La "ley de DDHH del Norte" es la más malsana anti-RPDC y anti-reunificación que la infame "ley de seguridad". 
					
					Ahora, en el territorio surcoreano resuenan fuertes voces de abolir totalmente la "ley de seguridad" y tal corriente se hace la opinión pública internacional.
					
					Los participantes en la 17 reunión del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU efectuada hace poco en Ginebra definieron la "ley de seguridad" de la banda títere como la ley anti-DDHH e insistieron enérgicamente en la abolición de tal "legislación".
					
					La banda de los traidores títeres debe eliminar cuanto antes la infame "ley de seguridad" de acuerdo con la demanda de la opinión pública interna y externa y poner de inmediato fin a la campaña de fabricación de la "ley de DDHH del Norte".
					
					En el caso contrario, ella sufrirá el vergonzoso fin siendo condenada por toda la nación coreana incluyendo distintos sectores y capas del Sur de Corea y la opinión pública internacional.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela peligrosidad de militarización de Japón
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela peligrosidad de militarización de Japón 
Pyongyang, 29 de junio (ATCC) -- La prefectura de Osaka, Japón, publicó un "reglamento", según el cual los maestros y empleados de las escuelas públicas regionales deben estar obligados a ponerse de pie durante la interpretación de Kimigayo.
					Esto comprueba que los reaccionarios japoneses se desesperan por inculcar el militarismo. 
					
					Revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este miércoles y prosigue:
					
					Con el fin de asentar la base ideológica del militarismo y resucitar la historia del pasado manchado de sangre, los reaccionarios japoneses fijaron sin escrúpulos Kimigayo como himno nacional y publicaron hasta el "reglamento" que obliga el "respeto" y "elogio" a esa canción que simboliza el arraigado rencor de los pueblos asiáticos. 
					
					En particular, toman a los maestros como objetos de aplicación de ese "reglamento" con la malsana intención de infundir a los alumnos de conciencia pura la concepción militarista de la historia y el sentimiento de venganza, convertirlos en los derechistas y chovinistas nacionales y por fin, utilizarlos como brigada de choque de agresión a ultramar.
					
					Para las fuerzas militaristas de Japón que pretenden tomar la venganza de su derrota, la nueva agresión es una cuestión de tiempo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun aboga por exitosas elecciones de diputados
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun aboga por exitosas elecciones de diputados 
Pyongyang, 29 de junio (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun en el editorial difundido este miércoles señala que los ciudadanos de la República Popular Democrática de Corea deben movilizarse como un solo hombre para celebrar con el elevado entusiasmo político y brillantes éxitos laborales el día de elecciones de diputados a los órganos del poder local y contribuir a consolidar con más firmeza  el poder popular 
					El poder de la RPDC es una poderosa arma política de la revolución y la construcción y verdadero servidor al pueblo, asevera el editorial y continúa:
					
					La historia de desarrollo del poder de la RPDC es la trayectoria de que bajo la sabia dirección del gran Líder y el gran partido el poder ha venido creando el ejemplo de la construcción del poder socialista y cumpliendo magníficamente la misión de representante del derecho independiente de las masas populares, de organizador de la capacidad y las actividades creadoras y de jefe encargado de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Las elecciones de diputados a los órganos del poder local son la importante labor política para consolidar monolíticamente el poder popular conforme a la demanda de la realidad en desarrollo.
					
					Con motivo de la histórica Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el poderío combativo de esta entidad se ha fortalecido extraordinariamente y bajo la dirección del partido se libra con vigor la ofensiva general por la construcción de gran potencia próspera.
					
					Cuando mediante las elecciones los órganos del poder local se compongan de los representantes del pueblo y su función y papel se eleven extraordinariamente, se podrá registrar el cambio revolucionario en la materialización de la línea y la política del partido y adelantar la victoria de la construcción del gran Estado próspero.
					
					Todos los ciudadanos deben participar en las elecciones con alto fervor político y demostrar una vez más nítidamente el noble espíritu del pueblo coreano tendente a celebrar el centenario del nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung como  máximo jubilo revolucionario de la nación.
